result.execSummary:
The defendant John E Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
**9/12/14 probation term commuted to three (3) years.

miscConds.notes: Pay $123.80 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund to which the defendant stipulates.

Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Pay the costs, assessments and surcharges associated with case 14CF1793 during period of probation. Failure to pay all costs, assessments, surcharges, restitution will result in entry of civil judgment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.

May not possess any pornographic materials.
May not have access to any of his spouses' financial accounts.
No contact with victim (J.R.M.), unless authorized by agent or pertaining to other court orders.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Absolute sobriety.
Sex offender assessment and treatment.
Mental health assessment and treatment.
Participate in Gamblers Anonymous or like program.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

charges.descr: Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $5434.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/24/14 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 10/02/23. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Court Findings and Order for payment of attorney fees and costs in the amount of $5434.00 to Atty Derek Goodman approved by Court.

Order Commuting Probation Term.
Pursuant to 973.09(2)(b)1, the probation term shall be commuted to three years.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to commute probation term.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H. Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Janis M. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 194 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 4 YEARS.  
Conditions of probation include:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Pay restitution of $123.80 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund to which the defendant stipulates.
-Pay the costs, assessments and surcharges associated with case 14CF1793 during period of probation.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS, SURCHARGES, RESTITUTION WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment.
-Mental health assessment and treatment.
-Participate in Gamblers Anonymous or like program.
-May not possess any pornographic materials.
-May not have access to any of his spouses' financial accounts.
-No contact with victim (J.R.M.), unless authorized by agent or pertaining to other Court orders.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Independent presentence report received and filed.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H. Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants the joint request for adjournment.  Case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing, however defense would like to proceed with a plea hearing. 

Pursuant to negotiations Count 1 is dismissed but read in for the purposes of sentencing.  As to Count 2:

  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.     Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Jury trial scheduled for 07/14/2014 is vacated. Defense will be ordering a private PSI.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State has not had a chance to review the defense suppression motion as she has been in trial for the last 10 days.
The Court will hear arguments as to the State's Motion for Consolidation of cases.  The Court will vacate the 6-24-2014 final pretrial date and set these matters for motion hearing on 6-30-2014.  Jury trial date of 7-14-2014 to stand.
Defense Objection to Consolidation of cases received and filed.

Attorney Derek H Goodman in court, defendant John E Morris not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has filed a motion to consolidate with 14CF1793 to which the defense has filed an objection today.
Defendant is to be present when the motion is argued and the Court renders its decision.
Defense counsel advises that he will be filing additional dispositive motions in the next 10 days.  Court directs that any additional motions are to be filed by 5-28-2014.
Speedy trial demand entered.  Case set for final pretrial on 6-24-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-14-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. Motion hearing is set for 6-3-2014 at 8:15am.
to Consolidate Cases for trial received and filed.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has charged new case, 14CF1793.  State informs defense and the court that she has a SPEEDY trial in Branch 25 beginning May 12 and trial will last all week.  Based on new charges the state and defense will not be prepared for trial on May 14.  The Court will convert the trial date to a scheduling date as new case will have gone through prelim court.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State is concerned as it mailed a large packet of discovery to defense counsel which he has not received (information was mailed to former law office and to date it has not been forwarded)  ADA Falk states that the incorrect address is listed in PROTECT system.  Atty Goodman had provided his business card with correct contact information to the state and it is attached on the inside of state's file.
The State advises that it will be issuing additional charges and withdraws its offer at this time.  Also, financial information has been forwarded to the White Collar Crime Unit for investigation.  At this time the parties are requesting an adjournment of the May 14 jury trial date.  The Court will set a date of 5-1-2014 for the initial appearance of the new charges.

Attorney Derek H. Goodman in court, defendant John E Morris not in court, in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 4-24-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-14-2014 at 8:15am.  All discovery to be completed by 4-1-2014. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-14-2014.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H. Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steve Wells-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Appointing Attorney at County Expense as to 14CF589 and 14Cf1793
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-06-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John E Morris in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducted indigency hearing and will appoint counsel to represent defendant at County expense and at the rate of $70/hour.  Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50/month commencing at the close of the case with authorization for repayment through civil judgment, tax intercept or wage assignment.  Appointment of Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Court appoints Atty Derek Goodman who accepts the appointment.  Case is adjourned to 3-6-2014 at 1:30pm for preliminary hearing.

Defendant John E Morris not in court, defendant in custody.  Jennifer Williams for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO DA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation and has not obtained counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  
  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.R.M. and the address of 4635 S. 20th St. #223, Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Carol Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
